front.div:
Zirconium dioxide stabilized with calcium and yttrium oxides at 800-II00~
possesses oxygen-ionic
conductivity [I], which makes it possible to use it as a solid electrolyte for high-temperature
fuel elements.
At 1700~ the electrical resistance of zirconium dioxide is reduced to 1 t2"cm [2], which means it can be
used as a basis for developing ceramic heating elements for high-temperature
furnaces in an oxidizing
atmosphere.
The electrical resistance of zirconia ceramics as a function of chemical and phase composi-
tions has been studied by many researchers
[1-3]. Zirconia ceramics used in high-temperature
installations can have different porosities which greatly affect the change in
the electrical properties of materials similar in composition.
